node.title: 'COVID is closer and becoming more real': Predictions vaccine complacency will fade as cases rise across Queensland
node.alt: A patient is injected with a vaccine during a clinical trial.
node.description: As Queensland braces for a rise in COVID-19 cases in the community, some parts of the state still have less than two-thirds of the population aged 15 and over fully vaccinated.
node.content:
["As Queensland braces for a rise in COVID-19 cases in the community, some parts of the state still have less than two-thirds of the\u00a0population aged 15 and over\u00a0fully vaccinated.", "The state lifted its border to fully vaccinated travellers from interstate hotspots yesterday, marking a new phase in the pandemic, with new Chief Health Officer John Gerrard expecting possibly \"more than hundreds\" of COVID-19 cases to arise in coming months.", "The latest federal health data provides a picture of vaccination levels across Queensland, including local government areas that are continuing to lag behind the state average.", "As of Sunday, 57.4 per cent of people aged 15+\u00a0in the Isaac local government area (LGA) had double-dose protection \u2013 an increase of about 4.6 percentage points since last week.", "Meanwhile in Yarrabah, 52.6 per cent of those aged 15+\u00a0had\u00a0received two doses, and in Cherbourg, 49.8 per cent in the same age bracket were fully vaccinated.", "That compares with 88.3 per cent of Queenslanders aged 16 and over having received their first dose and 81.3 per cent having received two.", "Griffith University virologist Nigel McMillan said the increase in vaccination rates had\u00a0been driven by the perception that \"COVID is closer and becoming more real to people\".", "\"I think that the 4 or 5 percentage [point]\u00a0jump can be explained because there are 46 cases active in the state right now\u00a0and\u00a0we're going to see lots more cases in the coming weeks,\" Professor McMillan said.", "", "
Professor McMillan says people are seeing that COVID is \"closer and becoming more real\".
", "Ian Mackay, a virologist at the University of Queensland, said people who were yet\u00a0to get vaccinated due to complacency might yet be spurred into action.", "\"I think those people might just need to see it [COVID] around them,\" he said.", "\"I don't understand why. All the horrible images have been [out]\u00a0there\".", "Dr Gerrard said it was inevitable that case numbers would increase after the borders reopened.", "\"How many we will see, and when this will occur, is still unclear,\" Dr Gerrard said.", "Authorities are screening travellers arriving in Queensland from COVID-19 hotspots by requiring a pre-departure negative COVID-19 test, as well as a second test on their fifth day in the state.", "Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk said it was physically impossible to check every single person coming in, and that\u00a0\"random checks\" would be carried out.", "More than 23,000 applications have been lodged for border passes so far, and Queensland Health Minister Yvette D'Ath said she was confident the state's system would be able to cope with demand from the five-day testing rule.", "On a single day during the south-east Queensland lockdown in August, more than 52,000 people came out to get tested.", "\"Am I confident that we can cope with that? Yes \u2014\u00a0we will monitor it very closely,\" Ms D'Ath said.", "", "
Yvette D'Ath says she is confident the state's system will be able to cope with demand from the five-day testing rule.(ABC News: Michael Lloyd)
", "\"We'll keep looking at the national guidance and advice on this, whether we need to keep maintain this testing into the future.", "\"But right now, we're only at 80 per cent double dose and we've just opened the borders.", "\"We will do the day 5\u00a0test but we'll monitor it very closely.\"", "
'Grab a mate and vaccinate'
", "In central Queensland, Isaac Regional Council Mayor Anne Baker is \"under no illusions in that with borders opening and travel resuming, we will see COVID come to regional Australia\".", "\"The Premier has been clear in communications that the Queensland government will apply lockdowns within the Isaac region where there is community transmission and the vaccination rate remains lower than 80 per cent,\" she said.", "\"I strongly encourage everyone who is eligible for the vaccine to roll up their sleeves, grab a mate and vaccinate.", "\"Getting the vaccine is about protecting yourself and your family and making sure we don\u2019t put additional pressure on the hospital system.\"", "", "
Councillor Baker says vaccination is \"without a doubt our greatest weapon to fight this disease\".(NRRT: Caitlyn Gribbin)
", "She said vaccination was \"without a doubt our greatest weapon to fight this disease\".", "\"People who are fully vaccinated are 86 per cent less likely to catch COVID and pass it on,\" she said.", "
'Staff are pretty tired'
", "Michael Harrison, CEO of pathology company Sullivan Nicolaides, told ABC Radio on Monday the demands on staff during the pandemic had been difficult, but they could now handle volumes of COVID testing that \"we couldn't deal with two years ago\".", "\"Our staff are pretty tired, it's been a really big year,\" Dr Harrison said.", "\"With the outbreaks we've had and the demands that have been put on us, we recognise this is another challenge we have to rise to."]
